ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.algorithm

Class KruskalMSF

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.algorithm.AbstractAlgorithm
      • ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.algorithm.KruskalMSF
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAlgorithm

    public class KruskalMSF
extends AbstractAlgorithm
    The Kruskal-algorithm calculates a minimal spanning forest. This implementation is based on pseudocode-description at:
    http://en. wikipedia.org/wiki/Kruskal%27s_algorithm
    The algorithm is implemented with a disjoint-set data structure:
    http://en. wikipedia.org/wiki/Disjoint-set_data_structure
    The DFS algorithm is used for finding cycles.
    Author:
    Patrick Kofmel (kofmp1@bfh.ch)

      • buildMSF

        private void buildMSF(IRestrictedGraph graph,
            IStepRecorder rec)
        Builds the minimal spanning forest. The Partion class is used for building the MSF. The Partition class is an implementation of a disjoint-set data structure.
        Parameters:
        graph -
        rec -
